result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Curtis Denell Jackson

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Curtis Denell Jackson in court.  Attorney Christian Thomas in court for Curtis Denell Jackson.  Attorney Dennis Patrick Murphy in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for arraignment. For reasons stated on the record, Parties requested adjournment of proceedings. Court grants request.  Case remains calendared in Branch 11. .
Arraignment scheduled for November 30, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
State's Response to Defendant's Motion to Dismiss, filed.
Defendant's Notice of Motion and Motion to Dismiss (Defective Bind-Over), filed.
Filed: Original Transcript of Preliminary Hearing (14 pages) commencing 09-29-2022, by Kristin Menzia.

Defendant Curtis Denell Jackson in court.  Attorney Christian Thomas in court for Curtis Denell Jackson.  Prosecuting attorney Thomas Hasle in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Preliminary hearing proceeded. Sworn for the State:  MPD Officer E. Mlodzik. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed. Defense requests an arraignment date.  Case is adjourned to Branch 11.
Arraignment scheduled for October 28, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Curtis Denell Jackson in court.  Attorney Christian Thomas appeared by video as a friend of the court for Curtis Denell Jackson.  Attorney Dennis Patrick Murphy in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a State V. Lee Hearing. SPD is unable to appoint counsel. The court appointed Attorney Christian Thomas to represent the defendant at the county's expense. The defendant is not required to reimburse Milwaukee County. Order Appointing Attorney at County Expense signed and filed. Court adjourns matter for a Preliminary hearing in Preliminary hearing court.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 29, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
OSPD Appointment of Counsel Report filed.

Defendant Curtis Denell Jackson appeared by video.  Prosecuting attorney Abby Rockendorf in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a preliminary hearing. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE to the trial court for a State V. Lee Hearing.
Hearing scheduled for September 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.
OSPD Appointment of Counsel Report, filed.

Defendant Curtis Denell Jackson in court.  Karine O'Byrne appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO
Case in court for preliminary hearing. States witness is present. OPD needs additional time to appoint an attorney. State requests the matter be set for a State V. Lee hearing or scheduling; denied. Court finds good CAUSE to adjourn preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 26, 2022 at 08:30 am.
all conditions of bond remain as previously set.

Defendant Curtis Denell Jackson in court.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Case in court for preliminary hearing. States witness is present. OPD needs additional time to appoint an attorney. States requests this matter be sent to the trial court for a State V. Lee hearing; denied.  Court finds good CAUSE to adjourn preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Notice of bond forfeiture mailed to defendant. ($2,500.00 signature bond) LW

Defendant Curtis Denell Jackson in court.  John Daniel Flynn appeared for the State of Wisconsin. PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Case in court for preliminary hearing. OPD needs additional time to appoint an attorney. Court adjourns case for an attorney to be appointed. Court finds good CAUSE to adjourn preliminary hearing.

Warrant is withdrawn. Court ordered the defendant to be booked and released within 48 hrs. If the defendant fails to do so another warrant will be issued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Signature bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 2500.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Defendant Curtis Denell Jackson not in court.   No Assistant District Attorney Available appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued REMAND TO COMMISSIONER. Defendant failed to be booked and release by 04/25/2022 at 5:00pm. Court ordered signature bond forfeited.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with TJ and TMS.

DEFENDANT WAS ORDERED BY THE COURT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON 04/25/2022. IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Curtis Denell Jackson in court with attorney David Thomas Conley.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Sanders, Branch 28.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 5, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 04/22/2022 @1p
